New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns became just the third player in New York Knicks history to record at least 30 points and 10 rebounds in three consecutive games.
Key Match Events: The New York Knicks extended their winning streak to nine games with a 119-103 victory against the Utah Jazz.
Josh Hart and Karl-Anthony Towns starred for the Knicks.
The Knicks were missing star point guard Jalen Brunson due to a calf issue and back-up guard Miles McBride due to a tight left hamstring.
The Utah Jazz had an early lead of 18-8 before falling to their fifth straight loss.
